main event: A UFO sighting was reported on 8 June 1954 at 0800L, describing a silvery, highly reflective, oval-shaped object disintegrating into 3-4 pieces as it moved in a lateral motion at a speed of 300-400 mph.
interesting points: The UFO was observed for 20-30 seconds and no sound was reported.
Radar from Pope AFB were in the air at the time of the sighting.
The object's trajectory included a rapid descent, change of course, and a 52-degree turn before gradually fading into the distance.
The weather at the time of the sighting was reported as clear with varying wind speeds at different altitudes.
Two Pope AFB aircraft were in the area at the time, but no unusual objects were found in the sky upon investigation.
witnesses: Lt. Col G.D. Adams, Major E.C. Broadhurst
